content: Today I loan to @shasan worth 500$ to complete the daily challenge on Duelbits Christmas promotion that offers 30% deposit bonus when I wager the full amount of my deposit.I’m just playing slow on Money Train 3 by Relax Gaming since I just want to get the daily tickets for the grand draw and recover partial of my loss using 30% bonus. The game becomes intense when I hit the 200 spin mark which I enter the bonus round with persistent collector.I manage to get approximately x1900 multiplier bet with 0.3$ bet and a 150$ right after that which I forgot to get the ss. In the end, I manage to take net profit 700$ excluding the repayment for the loan.  PS: I’m not telling that everyone should loan and gamble just to follow my step. I’m just sharing that sometimes loan money that use to gamble have good result. FYI, I have money on fiat to cover the loan immediately in case I lose everything. DON’T LOAN MONEY IF YOU CAN’T AFFORD TO PAY IT BEFORE THE DUE DATE.

comments.author: Assface16678
comments.body: Well, you do have a point, but thankfully you indicated in your topic the reminder about loaning without the means to pay for it before it's due. Although you win this time using the money you have loaned, it doesn't mean that this happening will also happen to others, because even if you say to follow your steps, we never know if the odds will still be in our hands. In short, maybe at that time your strategy works, but it will not happen all the time. So everyone that will read this topic, even if it's not a bad idea to loan money to be used in gambling, just make sure that you are ready for any consequences that you may face if things go wrong. Remember, gambling is a battle between win and lose, and you will be on either side; you will be on the winning side or the losing side, which we don't want to end up losing and suffering from the consequences.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: Coin_trader on December 05, 2023, 04:03:37 AMPS: I’m not telling that everyone should loan and gamble just to follow my step. I’m just sharing that sometimes loan money that use to gamble have good result. FYI, I have money on fiat to cover the loan immediately in case I lose everything. DON’T LOAN MONEY IF YOU CAN’T AFFORD TO PAY IT BEFORE THE DUE DATE.The beautiful thing about your story or experience was that you balanced it up. Many people take loans to gamble and just like you, they are lucky to win and make money from it. Others have also failed to win and ended up in debt. But your case is quite different because you have the money to repay the loan in case you lose the bet. Some people don't have such backup so they end up frustrated and sometimes depressed. However, this behaviour of borrowing to fund gambling shouldn't be consistent because it could lead to addiction and debt. Occasionally one can decide to take loans to fund a gambling budget but there should be some restraints. I am also sceptical about spreading this kind of information because gamble newbies might misunderstand it which could affect their finances negatively. These new gamblers might not be able to control this kind of behaviour and end up incurring large debt because of gambling. However, congratulations on your win.

comments.author: danherbias07
comments.body: Lucky! Congratulations bro. Not everyone will have the same ending as yours so yes, I agree that borrowing money should not be recommended to anyone in the gambling industry. Man, that may have been feeling pretty good for you because you can just cash it out pay the loan, and then you got back what was lost. I mean, for me, if I hit such a good lucky streak I am out or I will just cover that wagering requirement that is needed and run as fast as I can when it's done. Control and discipline, we need that after a lucky win. If there's a loan that needs to be paid then pay it first, leave some balance in the gambling site, and then maybe try to build from it. But once it is gone, I won't jeopardize my profits by depositing again because luck sometimes doesn't strike on the same day, the higher chance is for the casino to take it back afterward and we don't want to be in that same position again where we chase our losses.

comments.author: Nheer
comments.body: Op, although you might be lucky this time but you should try to avoid taking chances with loan amounts. What would you have done to repay Shasan if you hadn't won the game? Do you have an alternative? People on this site are constantly reminded of the risks associated with borrowing money to gambling, but apparently not everyone follows this advise. In fact, some people may choose to disregard the warnings even in the face of our best efforts to enlighten them. It is not a smart idea to start something that has a 50/50 probability of success with a loan because gambling is an extremely risky investment and the possibilities of winning are entirely dependent on luck. We should think about losing as much as winning. If you lose the money, what are your plans? How are you going to repay your loan? To prevent needless stress when trying to pay off your debt, you should only gamble with money you can afford to lose.
